meanings.sent1: My friend's last name is Davies.
meanings.sent2: Many people in Wales have the surname Davies.
meanings.sent3: When Mr. Davies introduced himself, everyone thought he was related to the famous author!
meanings.sent4: The Davies family tree stretches back for generations in Wales.
meanings.sent5: At the Davies family reunion, there were over a hundred relatives present.

meanings.definition: Davies (verb): To act or speak in a clever or witty manner.
meanings.sent1: She always davies her way out of trouble with her quick thinking.
meanings.sent2: During the debate, he davies with such intelligence that everyone was impressed.
meanings.sent3: The comedian davies his jokes so well that the audience can't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: She davies through life's challenges with a smile on her face.
meanings.sent5: His ability to davies in any situation makes him a great storyteller.
